alert.note: Alert for Allegheny (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 10:20AM EST until February 20 at 3:00AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh PA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Allegheny River At Mosgrove affecting Armstrong County. Allegheny River At CW Bill Young Dam affecting Allegheny County. Allegheny River At Kittanning affecting Armstrong County. Allegheny River At Natrona affecting Allegheny and Westmoreland Counties.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz. PAC003-190330- /O.NEW.KPBZ.FL.W.0013.220218T2200Z-220220T0800Z/ /ACMP1.1.ER.220218T2200Z.220219T1200Z.220220T0200Z.NO/ 1020 AM EST Fri Feb 18 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Allegheny River at CW Bill Young Dam. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Sunday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM EST Friday the stage was 15.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this afternoon to 18.3 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening to 13.2 feet and begin rising again early Tuesday morning. It will rise to 13.3 feet Tuesday evening. It will then fall to 13.2 feet and begin rising again early Wednesday morning. It will then rise again but remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
